revision.comment: [[Wikipedia:Bots/Requests for approval/APersonBot 8|Bot]] updating 1 category with sort keys for an article about a battle
revision.text:
{{Infobox military conflict |conflict=Battle of Spancel Hill |partof= |image= |caption= |date= 1559 |place=[[Spancel Hill]], [[County Clare]], [[Kingdom of Ireland|Ireland]] |casus= |territory= |result= Victory for Sir Donnell O'Brien |combatant1= Earl of Thomond's supporters |combatant2= Sir Donnell O'Brien's supporters |commander1= [[Connor O'Brien, 3rd Earl of Thomond]]
[[Richard Burke, 2nd Earl of Clanricarde]] |commander2= Sir [[Donnell O'Brien]] |strength1= |strength2= |casualties1= |casualties2= |casualties3= |notes= }} The '''Battle of Spancel Hill''' took place in 1559 in [[County Clare]], [[Kingdom of Ireland|Ireland]] close to modern [[Kilraghtis]] when a force led by Sir [[Donnell O'Brien]] defeated his rival for leadership of the O'Briens [[Connor O'Brien, 3rd Earl of Thomond]] and his ally [[Richard Burke, 2nd Earl of Clanricarde]]. Although primarily a battle for local power amongst rival [[Gaelic Ireland|Gaelic]] factions it had wider ramifications. The defeat was a blow to the current [[Lord Lieutenant]] of Ireland [[Thomas Radclyffe, 3rd Earl of Sussex]] who had strongly supported Thomond and had led Crown troops into the area the previous year to install the Earl in power.Brady p.98 By contrast the Irish opponents of Sussex were known to be sympathetic to Sir Donnell and used his victory as evidence of Sussex's incompetence. In turn these two factions were allied with rival power groups at the English Court. Sussex was forced to dispatch a fresh expedition of Royal forces into the area in 1560 to protect Thomond. Eventually a compromise was reached in which Sir Donnell was granted a status independent of Thomond's overlordship which brought peace to the area.Brady p.99 ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Bibliography== * Brady, Ciaran. ''The Chief Governors: The Rise and Fall of Reform Government in Tudor Ireland, 1536-1588''. Cambridge University Press, 1994. [[Category:1559 in Ireland]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1559|Spancel Hill]] {{battle-stub}}
